content:
I just updated my local inferno-program instance to 1.8.0, and my terminology files aren't getting picked up. I ran the terminology generation a while back (I think 1.6.0), and I've just been copying the files forward into resources/terminology/validators. With 1.8.0, doing that file copy gives me the banner that terminology files are missing. I've been looking at PR#337 and PR#391, and I'm curious if I need to re-run the terminology build to get fresh files that work with those updates. Or do I just need to do something with terminology_config.yml? I tried using the example file, but still no luck.

Anyway, I can rerun terminology generation if necessary, but it is a whole process so I wanted to ask before I tried that.

@Cooper Thompson Can you verify that files are copied to resources\terminology\validators\bloom folder?
image.png

Ah. I see. I missed the docker-compose.yml change where you moved the volume mapping for the terminology directory up a level. When I said I was copying the files, I was actually using a symlink. But with the new volume mapping the symlink was getting pulled into the container and it couldn't resolve it.

I can figure it out from here. Thanks!
